channel.title: Virus
channel.description: So I have this virus on my computer that puts ads EVERYWHERE! Any idea what virus this is and how I can remove it? I've already ran quick and full scans using malwarebites. It's really annoying because it puts ads in all the fucking text and shit and it slows my computer down...

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

Spades:

You can get some free virus protection. I recommend Avast, they are pretty good. I also recommend Malwarebytes. Both free and easy to use. They can clean up your computer.

Eww don’t do that avast slows your pc down allot get avira it works and its small and your pc still runs fast

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

anytime mate saved you having to pay hundreds of dollars to a store to do it

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @Michael_P1 Michael P
item.description:
@Michael_P1 wrote:

[quote=“Ruzylo, post:9, topic:539766”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=658609.msg4405383#msg4405383 date=1391811734]
go to chrome - settings - under the hood/toolbar/extensions whatever it is called and see if there are any strange plugins or something

go to control panel and check for installations that look strange (there is a common one at the moment called media player vx.x that is currently swarming the internet may want to see if that’s it! )

I would suggest the following:

http://www.bleepingcomputer.com/download/adwcleaner/

and

https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=2&cad=rja&ved=0CDQQFjAB&url=http%3A%2F%2Fdownload.cnet.com%2FSpybot-Search-Destroy%2F3000-8022_4-10122137.html&ei=hFz1UpusKMeT1AHLvIGABg&usg=AFQjCNE50gsAfrMUHA4-AptHo7730jbg2w&sig2=wZRXptK0TqrtwYn62RheRw&bvm=bv.60983673,d.dmQ

see what comes up

I would be more than glad to take a look as well just let me know in advance so I can get a test profile up
[/quote]Hes watched alot of prawns and has had to remove many viruses ! Trust him![/quote]

Lol’d. It’s gone now, thanks guys!

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

remove the extension “Youtube ad blocker” it’s not always named that but that’s the most common one as far as I know.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @Michael_P1 Michael P
item.description:
@Michael_P1 wrote:

Spades:

It’s easy to remove. They are either a plugin for your browser, or if you are using Windows go to Programs and Features (Win 7) or Add or Remove Software (Xp) and scroll through the list and remove it. You can organize by date added and you can usually find it fairly easy.

I looked through it and couldn’t find anything.

I’m using Chrome.

My system restore isn’t working from past viruses…

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

It’s easy to remove. They are either a plugin for your browser, or if you are using Windows go to Programs and Features (Win 7) or Add or Remove Software (Xp) and scroll through the list and remove it. You can organize by date added and you can usually find it fairly easy.
